name: Uh, what site is this style for?
description: Shows the style subcategory in the search results. If a style has no subcategory (global styles, e.g.), its category is shown instead.
additional_info:
Example (the least popular dark styles):
https://userstyles.org/styles/browse?as=1&search_terms=dark&sort=popularity&sort_direction=asc

When used with style 121425, long subcategory names may partially cover the screenshot source label. Example: PokemonShowDown.com
https://userstyles.org/styles/browse/pokemonshowdown

<del><s>Subcategory can be displayed on style pages as well as in search results. Currently this conflicts with style 93025.</s></del> <ins>Resolved - update both style 121473 and style 93025.

2015-12-13: style 121833 also uses #subcategory. Fixed; update this style to resolve the conflict.

<small>https://userstyles.org/styles/browse?as=1&category=userstyles.org&search_terms=%40author+hideheader&sort=updated_date&sort_direction=desc</small>

style_settings.label: Subcategory on the style pages, too?
